executive_summary: The Pet Photography industry, which includes portrait, commercial and still photography services, has fallen over the five years to 2023 amid contentious economic conditions and competition from smartphone cameras. The industry has responded to shifting consumer preferences by increasing the number of nonemployer professionals who can offer industry services at a lower rate than large, established companies. Growth in per capita disposable income and total advertising expenditure have partially offset declines in the pet photography industry. However, the COVID-19 pandemic precipitated a massive decline in revenue in 2020 as pet photographers and their subjects were often prohibited from gathering together. Consequently, the industry has yet to achieve pre-pandemic levels of income. Revenue is anticipated to fall at a CAGR of 3.2% to $140.5 million over the five years to 2024, including a 1.4% decrease in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Smartphone Cameras Will Edge Out Professional Photographic Equipment, Even Within The Professional Circles
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As smartphone manufacturers relentlessly improve camera capabilities, commercial businesses in the United States are poised to favor these over professional-grade photographic solutions. The gap between traditional digital cameras and comprehensive, lightweight smartphone counterparts will continue to close significantly in quality, accessibility, and convenience. Phone cameras can be easily charged, photos can be transferred back to the cloud and basic editing systems can even be run. As a result of increased smartphone usage, pet photographer services have been demanded less since customers can take photos of their pets themselves.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Throughout 2029, an economic recovery and growing disposable income will drive growth for the industry. If photographers can cater to niche services and offer products that smartphones can't create, this will increase demand.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Industry revenue is anticipated to rise at a CAGR of 1.9% to $154.5 million over the five years to 2029.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: PHOTOGRAPHERS WILL MOVE FURTHER INTO THEIR NICHES AND USE PICTURES TO TELL BROADER STORIES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: US pet photographers will increasingly proliferate into specialized market niches, differentiating their portfolios with a defined narrative or issue-driven focus rather than purely their skills. Swift adaptation to unique and appealing niche sectors will manifest as a crucial survival strategy for an ever-growing industry mission in equipping itself with market-relevant skills.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: STEADY DEMAND THROUGHOUT THE OUTLOOK PERIOD CAN BE ATTRIBUTED TO A RISE IN THE NUMBER OF PETS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The rise in the number of pets will continue to boost demand for pet photography services as per capita disposable income grows and economic conditions improve. With unemployment expected to decrease over the next five years and consumer spending expected to grow, more pet parents will increase.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry photograph pets both in studios and on location.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Number of pets (cats and dogs)

key_trends: The price of photography sessions is a major form of competition. Pet photographer providers must ensure that prices are competitive so that customers remain loyal.

Pet photographing facilities benefit from being located near veterinarians and other animal establishments. By operating near these facilities, operators can minimize costs spent on acquiring key customers.

Revenue fell due to the pandemic. Since demand for pet photography services is typically tied to disposable income levels and general economic conditions, the pandemic caused a lot of economic uncertainty. This economic uncertainty made pet owners more reluctant to spend their money on discretionary pet photography services.

Growth will start again over the next five years. Demand has expanded since many pets have recently been adopted during and after the pandemic, and the rate of revenue increases will be steady throughout 2028.
Pet photographers don't benefit from any specific government assistance. The industry does receive some indirect assistance from various related industry associations.

The increasing population diversity has improved demand for the industry's services. Younger demographics tend to want pictures more frequently as pets are increasingly viewed as valued family members.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Households may demand pet photography services during special occasions or when they get a new pet. Although this is the largest market, many households have been demanding less professional photography services as smartphone cameras become a great substitute.

Businesses often use pet photography services for marketing and advertising, as well as getting photos for publications, including annual reports, brochures, and training materials. Another important market in this area is the publishing sector, which uses commercial photography services for usage in textbooks, novels and comic books.

The healthcare industry has grown interested in professional pet photography services to document and explain complex medical procedures. The perceived credibility and professionalism of healthcare facilities are enhanced through the use of high-quality images for digital marketing and branding. Philanthropic organizations leverage photography services to document the progress and challenges of their initiatives, serving as compelling storytelling tools for fundraising and awareness campaigns. Professional photo shoots are often arranged for key events like fundraisers or charity marathons, which later help draw continued support from donors.

products_and_services.product_description: In-studio photography sessions are when the owners and their pets go to a specific studio for a photography or video session. In-studio sessions are generally the least expensive since the consumer is travelling and just utilizing the photographer's equipment and services.

On-location photography sessions are when consumers and photographers agree to meet at a specified location for a photo shoot. These sessions are typically more expensive since the photographer must commute to a particular location and bring all the necessary equipment for the photo shoot. Despite the higher price point, this type of session is the most popular since consumers can choose a location that is special to them.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Special Event Photography or Video Services
products_and_services.product_description: Special event photography or video services are when the operator attends a special event, like a wedding, and captures all the moments during a consumer's special day. These services tend to be the most expensive since an operator must commute, bring all the necessary equipment and stay at a particular location for an extended period of time.
Additional services include stock photo licensing, digital photo and photofinishing services.

tier_1_suppliers: Camera & Film Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Audio & Video Equipment Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: This industry is sensitive to fluctuations in disposable income because its services are discretionary rather than necessary. Disposable income growth positively affects industry revenue, as it increases consumers' propensity to purchase photography services rises. If per capita disposable income decreases, then this can pose a potential threat to the industry.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast region has the highest percentage of both business establishments and population at around 30% each.
The West region has the second highest percentage of both business establishments and population at around 20% each.
The Mid-Atlantic region has around 15% of both business establishments and population.
The Great Lakes region has around 15% of both business establishments and population.
The Southwest region has around 10% of both business establishments and population.
The Plains region has around 5% of both business establishments and population.
The Rocky Mountains region has around 5% of both business establishments and population.
The percentage data for the New England region is not present in the given text.

basis_points.basis_description: The price of photography sessions is a major form of competition. Pet photographer providers must ensure that prices are competitive so that customers remain loyal.

Pet photographing facilities benefit from being located near veterinarians and other animal establishments. By operating near these facilities, operators can minimize costs spent on acquiring key customers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs typically focus on photography and videography equipment as well as one-use components such as reflectors, batteries, ink and the appropriate printer paper. Over the past five years, the price of computers and peripheral equipment has declined, translating to the fall of purchase costs as a share of industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Today's consumers can choose from a variety of independent, amateur photographers who are capable of taking high-quality pictures with the newest digital cameras and photo-editing tools. Manufacturers like Canon, Sony, Olympus, and Nikon have continually released newer models with improved image quality, more cutting-edge capabilities and more affordable costs.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Since the Industry is a Mature Luxury Service, Demand Tends to Follow the Business Cycle
volatility_points.volatility_description: Since the industry follows a business cycle, volatility is generally lower during periods of consistent economic growth. This means volatility is also caused by a disruption in the economic environment. This was clearly seen when revenue plummeted during the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020.

FAQs.question: What causes volatility in this industry?
FAQs.answer: Volatility is caused by a disruption in the economic environment, as evidenced by revenue plummeting during the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020.
